required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of PRCL-02 in Healthy Volunteers and Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Incomplete Crossover Single Oral Dose Escalation of PRCL-02 in Normal Healthy Volunteers (Part A) and Multiple Oral Dose Escalation in Normal Healthy Volunteers (Part B) and in Chronic Plaque Psoriasis Patients (Part C)

brief_summary.textblock: This study consists of three parts: single oral dose escalation in healthy volunteers (Part A), and multiple oral dose escalations in healthy volunteers (Part B) and in participants with chronic plaque psoriasis (Part C)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Serious Adverse Events (Part A)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a serious adverse event, regardless of causality, by dose and treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Serious Adverse Events (Part B)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a serious adverse event, regardless of causality, by dose and treatment

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a serious adverse event, regardless of causality, by dose and treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 24 hours post-dose on day 2

secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in triplicate 12-lead ECG

secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in triplicate 12-lead ECG

secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in single 12-lead ECG

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Single 12-Lead ECG in Part C
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in single 12-lead ECG

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs in Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Respiration Rate, Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Temperature

secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal physical exam findings

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve from Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-âˆž) in Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to infinity

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve During the Dosing Interval (24h) (AUC0-tau) in Part B
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve during the dosing interval of 24 hours (24h)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Plasma Concentration-Time Curve During the Dosing Interval (24h) (AUC0-tau) in Part C
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve during the dosing interval (24h)

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum or Trough Concentration (Cmin)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum or trough concentration of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Lag Time: Time Delay Between Drug Administration and First Observed Plasma Concentration (Tlag)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Time delay between administration of PRCL-02 and first observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination Rate (Ke)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Elimination rate of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Elimination Half-Life (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal elimination half-life of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time Curve from Time Zero to 24 Hours Post-dose (AUC0-24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from time zero to 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time Curve from Time Zero to the Last Observed Time Point (AUC0-t)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from time zero to the last observed time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Clearance (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent clearance of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution of PRCL-02

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulation Ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to approximately 29 days (Part A); 33 days (Part B), 31 days (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: Accumulation ratio of PRCL-02

arm_group.description: Two escalating sequences of single oral doses of PRCL-02, in 3 periods, starting at 4 milligrams (mg)
Two escalating sequences of matching placebo oral tablets, in 3 periods
Multiple oral doses of PRCL-02 for 28 days, at up to 3 dose levels
Multiple oral doses of placebo for 28 days, at matching dose levels
Multiple oral doses of PRCL-02 for 28 days, at up to 3 dose levels
Multiple oral doses of placebo for 28 days, at matching dose levels

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Parts A and B
- Be 18 to 55 years old
- Be healthy with absence of clinically significant illness
- Male participants must agree to use medically accepted methods of contraception with all sexual partners during the study, and for 90 days after
- Female participants must be postmenopausal or surgically sterile
- Have venous access sufficient for blood sampling
- Be a non-smoker
Part C
- Be 18 to 75 years old
- Have chronic plaque psoriasis based on a confirmed diagnosis of plaques for at least 6 months
- Have at least 2 evaluable plaques located in at least 2 body regions
Exclusion Criteria:
Parts A and B
- Significant abnormalities in vital signs, laboratory tests, electrocardiogram, or history of heart disease, some allergies, or infections
- Hepatic or renal impairment
- Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, or Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
- Female participants who are pregnant or breast feeding
- Recent or ongoing infection
- History of alcohol or drug abuse
- Current or recent enrollment in a clinical trial judged not compatible with this study
Part C
- Have highly active psoriatic arthritis
- Have pustular, erythrodermic and/or guttate forms of psoriasis
- Have had a clinically-significant flare of psoriasis during the last 12 weeks
- Currently or recently taking certain prescribed therapies for psoriasis
- Use of selected topical treatments within 4 weeks prior to starting the study (use of some emollients without urea is allowed, except on one lesion for biopsy)

facility.name: Centre de Dermatologie et Chirurgie Dermatologique
